column4: how would I go about setting the monitor refresh rate when in gdm?
I think you can set them in gnome after login, or in "dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
I changed it in my screen resolution dialogue and made sure to check the "make these the default settings" box, my desktop is now fine, but gdm is still messed up
gdm, okay, do that in "dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg fixed my problem, thanks
it's a magic command you should remember for good
lcd or crt?
its a laptop
run gnome-display-properties to double check the resolution is correct, but still hard to imagine a shift :(
its only slight, a few pixels, it does not hinder my using the OS at all really, its just slightly annoying
still, is the resolution correct? VertRefresh ?
that is the correct res for the panel, and the vert refresh is 60
might be a hardware problem, I don't understand how can you shift on a LCD :(
yea, I was afraid of that at first, but it works fine under windows... :-(
anything in bios?
there is an option for autoscaling of non-native resolutions in teh bios, I have that set so that if I go down in res it fills the screen.
yes, but you are at the default resolution, that has no effect now
yea, thats what I figured, but there are no other options for video in there, so I don't think its a bios issue
try another video driver, different version, or different driver, like vesa
I'll do that
ah-hah!  vesa fixed it!  :-)  thanks!
file a bug to xorg :(
will do, its a problem with the trident driver
